title: Domain 1.1: Compare and contrast various types of security controls.
content:
📚 Categories of Controls

  • 🖥️ Technical: Controls enforced through technology.
    Example: firewalls, antivirus software, ACLs.
  • 👔 Managerial: Policy-based and administrative in nature.
    Example: risk assessments, security planning, compliance audits.
  • 🧑‍🏭 Operational: Procedural controls performed by people.
    Example: user training, incident response, change management.
  • 🏢 Physical: Real-world barriers and protection.
    Example: locks, guards, fences, ID cards.

🧭 Control Types (Purposes)

  • 🚫 Preventive: Stops incidents before they occur.
    Example: locked doors, security training.
  • 🛑 Deterrent: Discourages malicious activity.
    Example: surveillance signage, visible guards.
  • 🔍 Detective: Identifies events after they happen.
    Example: CCTV, IDS (Intrusion Detection Systems).
  • 🛠️ Corrective: Restores systems after a security incident.
    Example: backup recovery, patching vulnerabilities.
  • 🧩 Compensating: Alternative measures when the primary control isn't possible.
    Example: manual approvals instead of automated access control.
  • 📢 Directive: Provides direction and expectations.
    Example: policies, SOPs, warning signs.
